Posts.Content: Eva_V wrote: Hi, everyone. I'm Eva and I have stage 4, ER+ breast cancer with bone Mets. I was diagnosed in November of 2012. I'm having a situation and I'd like to know if anyone else has gone through anything similar. I threw my back out about a week and a half ago. It was so bad that my Pain Management Dr prescribed muscle relaxers and added Motrin to my daily regime of medication: letrozole, dilauded, Lexapro, odansetron, etc. After they were added, my legs from below the knee, ankles and feet have been swollen and painful. But, up until the last few nights, I've been sleeping in a chair, in the living room. The spasms in my back were that bad. I try to elevate my feet if I can, but, the swelling only subsides a little bit. Is this something I should go to the ER about or do you think it will resolve itself? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Leg, ankle and foot swelling Eva_V DaughterOfStageIV

Posts.Content: Eva_V wrote: I'm 45 and was diagnosed with stage IV breast cancer, estrogen positive, with bone mets three months ago.  I'd like to talk to people that are going through the same thing.  I'm going through hormonal therapy and recently had surger to have my ovaries and tubes removed.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Stage IV - Estrogen positive - Bone Mets... Eva_V kebab

Posts.Content: Eva_V wrote: I had blood work completed a few weeks ago and my CEA results were slightly elevated.  I am going for a PET scan on May 23rd and I'm scared out of my mind.  I'm also going through a severe depression that I can't seem to shake.  Any words of advice? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: ER Positive with bone mets and elevated CEA Eva_V intothewoods
